ID.description: ID is the identifier of the object.

alertDefinition.description:
<llm-instruction>This part of the input schema is truncated. If you want to pass the property `alertDefinition` to the tool, first call the tool `expandSchema` with "/properties/alertDefinition" in the list of pointers. This will return the expanded input schema which you can then use in the tool call. You may have to call `expandSchema` multiple times if the schema is nested.</llm-instruction>
<property-description>Represents a definition of an alert.</property-description>

alertDefinitionName.description: The name identifier of the alert definition that triggered the alert.

alertEvents.description: The events related to the alert.

items.description: Represents an alert event raised by a policy.

alertDefinition.description: The name of the alert definition that triggered the alert event.

alertDefinitionNamespace.description: The namespace of the alert definition.

IP.description: The source IP address of the request.

app.description: Describes the principal information of an application.

component.description: The component of the application request.

labels.description: The list of labels attached to an application request.

claims.description: List of claims extracted from the user query.

team.description: The team that was used to authorize the request.

tokenName.description: The name of the token, if any.

user.description: Describes the principal information of a user.

name.description: Identification bit that will be used to identify the origin of the request.

provider.description: The provider used that the alert came from.

timestamp.description: When the alert event was raised.

counter.description: The number of times the alert was raised.

end.description: When the alert was last raised.

start.description: When the alert was first raised.

updateTime.description: Last update date of the object.
